Rio de Janeiro, Brazil (CNN) Olympic medalist Ryan Lochte and three other US swimmers were safe and cooperating with police Sunday after being robbed at gunpoint in Rio de Janeiro, the U S Olympic Committee said.

Ryan Lochte and three other U S swimmers were robbed by thieves who put a cocked gun to Lochte’s head in Rio de Janeiro early Sunday morning, the U S swimmer told NBC  Lochte and his friends were in a taxi, going to visit a Brazilian swimmer, when the robbers stopped them.

US swimmer Ryan Lochte and three of his Olympic teammates were robbed at gunpoint as they left a party in Rio de Janeiro early Sunday, with one thug pressing a cocked pistol to the athlete’s head after he refused to kneel.
RIO DE JANEIRO  —   The three other United States swimmers were lying on the ground, following their assailant’s orders, when the gunman turned to Ryan Lochte, one of Team USA’s charming stars.
Patrick Sandusky, a spokesman for the U S Olympic Committee, said in a statement that in addition to Lochte, three other swimmers were robbed: Gunnar Bentz, Jack Conger and Jimmy Feigen.

Lochte said he and fellow Rio   relay swimmers Gunnar Bentz, Jack Conger and Jimmy Feigen were heading back to the Olympic Village at around 2:30 a. m. to 3 a. m. when their cab was stopped by armed men claiming to be cops.
Lochte and fellow swimmers Gunnar Bentz, Jack Conger and Jimmy Feigen had left a hospitality house hosted by France early Sunday in a taxi bound for the Olympic Village.

Lochte, who’s known for his   nonchalant attitude, added: ”And then the guy pulled out his gun, he cocked it, put it to my forehead, and he said, ’Get down,’ and I put my hands up, I was like ’whatever.’ He took our money, he took my wallet  —   he left my cellphone, he left my credentials”.

”I refused, I was like, ’We didn’t do anything wrong, so  —   I’m not getting down on the ground.’ ”And then the guy pulled out his gun, he cocked it, put it to my forehead and he said, ’Get down,’ and I put my hands up, I was like ’Whatever.’ He took our money, he took my wallet  —   he left my cellphone, he left my credentials”.
